name: Ceridian Dayforce Connector
description: Dayforce, provided by Ceridian, is a cloud-based solution for Payroll, Benefits, Workforce Management, Human Resources, Talent Management, Document Management, and Analytics. You can use this connector to connect to perform operations on Dayforce HCM API within WSO2 MI development workflow.

operations.description: Init operation

operations.description: Retrieve an employee's employment statuses that control how employee's pay, time-off, statutory holidays, etc. are calculated. REST API

operations.description: Create an employee's employment statuses that control how employee's pay, time-off, statutory holidays, etc. are calculated. REST API

operations.description: Retrieve an employee's clock device groups that control access to the clocks the employee can punch on. REST API

operations.name: getAListOfDocuments
operations.description: This request allows to retrieve the list of documents attached to an employee. The response includes the document GUID used to retrieve contents with Get Document Details REST API

operations.name: getDocumentDetails
operations.description: This request allows to retrieve the contents of a particular document. It requires the document GUID that can be obtained with Get a List of Documents REST API

operations.name: getAvailability
operations.description: Availabilty represents the periods an employee is available to be scheduled for work. This request allows you to retrieve a single employee's daily availability between two dates. In order to use it, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getSchedules
operations.description: Retrieve the configured schedules for a single employee for every day within a defined period. In order to use this request, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getTimeAwayFromWork
operations.description: Retrieve the scheduled time away from work (TAFW) periods of a single employee. In order to use this request, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getEmployeePunches
operations.description: Extract the worked shift data for several employees at a time. Required parameters for the call include FilterTransactionStartTimeUTC and FilterTransactionEndTimeUTC. The system will search for all employee punch records that were modified between these two dates. The two dates must be 7 days apart or less. REST API

operations.name: getEmployeeRawPunches
operations.description: Retrieve raw punches as they are entered at the clock REST API

operations.name: postEmployeeRawPunches
operations.description: Insert a raw punch. This raw punch record will be treated as a punch coming from the clock and be validated against configured punch policies REST API

operations.name: getJobPostings
operations.description: Availabilty represents the periods an employee is available to be scheduled for work. This request allows you to retrieve a single employee's daily availability between two dates. In order to use it, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: patchI9Order
operations.description: Update I-9 employment eligibility verification order status REST API
